title: Executive Order 12507-Continuance of the President's Commission on Organized Crime
content: By the authority vested in me as President by the Constitution and laws of the United States of America, including the Federal Advisory Committee Act, as amended (5 U.S.C. App. I), it is hereby ordered that Section 4(b) of Executive Order No. 12435, establishing the President's Commission on Organized Crime, is amended to provide as follows:
"(b) The Commission shall terminate on April 1, 1986, or thirty days after it submits its final report, whichever occurs first."

RONALD REAGAN
The White House,
March 22, 1985.
[Filed with the Office of the Federal Register, 11:11 a.m., March 25, 1985]
citation: Ronald Reagan, Executive Order 12507-Continuance of the President's Commission on Organized Crime Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/259339
